snippet: Anthony D. Marshall is scheduled to surrender this week to begin serving a prison sentence for stealing millions of dollars from his mother.
abstract: Anthony D Marshall, 89-year-old son of late philanthropist Brooke Astor, is scheduled to surrender to authorities to begin serving a prison sentence of one to three years for stealing millions of dollars from his mother's estate; Marshall's lawyers are making a last-ditch effort to keep him at home, arguing that he would be the oldest person ever admitted to a New York prison for a nonviolent crime.
lead_paragraph: Anthony D. Marshall is scheduled to surrender this week to begin serving a prison sentence for stealing millions of dollars from his mother.

headline.main: At 89, Astor’s Son Wouldn’t Be the Oldest in Prison
headline.print_headline: At 89, Astor’s Son Wouldn’t Be the Oldest in Prison
